H0.text: Fog rising off a river is an example of a chemical change.

H1.text: Wood burning in a fireplace is an example of a chemical change.

H2.text: Ice cream melting in the sunshine is an example of a chemical change.

H3.text: Grinding peppercorn into pepper flakes is an example of a chemical change.

A4.text: Combustion (fire) was the first controlled chemical reaction discovered by humans, in the form of campfires and bonfires, and continues to be the main method to produce energy for humanity.

A5.text: The most common examples are natural gas, propane, kerosene, diesel, petrol, charcoal, coal, wood, etc.
